channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on wall and street box at the beginning of Wynne road SW9., 11th December
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a wall and a street box at the beginning of Wynne road SW9. The graffiti has been there for over a week. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 320, Brixton Road, Brixton, Greater London

item.title: Tree branch falling as can see in photo and trees taller then my house, 11th December
item.description:
There is over 9 trees in back back garden all taller then my house behind the trees tree branch is falling and there is a huge hole in the ground also. I have 2 children with adhd and asd this isn’t safe for them at all. They have no danger awareness etc and for how high they are can climb and seriously hurt them self not to add the tree may fall on them due to the branch broken hanging, and then the hole they can call and seriously hurt them self. L and q are refusing do sort this issue out but it’s a danger hazard and risk to my Disabled children

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Cleve Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New Zebra crossing with speed bump outside 168 Haverstock Hill, 11th December
item.description:
Good evening As part of building a new cycle lane on haverstock hill , a new large speed bump at the zebra crossing has been built outside my home on 168 haverstock hill . Every time a bus or a lorry passes over the speed bump , its literally shaking my entire house . Can you please look into it as soon as possible before structural damages happens to my house or neighbours property. The new speed bump was built 1 week ago . Thank you M Assor
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 170, Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I’ve reported this, but a local restaurant is dumping their restaurant waste, including oil, 11th December
item.description:
I’m reporting repeated incidents of illegal commercial waste dumping by food trucks operating at 103 Union Street, London SE1 0LA, managed by Samsite Ltd (one of the 9 vendors operating out of the site is dumping here). They have been regularly discarding meat waste, used oil cans, and other rubbish into the residential bins outside my property. We have had more rats, oil spills and rotten food smell from the waste that they are putting in the residential bins. This has caused overflowing bins, strong smells, and hygiene issues. As per the Environmental Protection Act 1990, commercial waste must not be disposed of in domestic bins, and this activity amounts to fly-tipping. I took these pictures this evening of these bins overflowing with mostly oil cans this time. I have previous pictures of the guys dumping rotten food, and hazardous waste from the food into the bins (including videos of where they are coming out of). This is the white van that comes up multiple times a week and I got their license plate number. They dump at least three times a week filling up our residential garbage cans.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping Hot Spot side of Candy Box Maple Crescent, 11th December
item.description:
A child's car seat has been dumped at the location. Further along by the green junction box there is an accumulation of broken glass bottles and empty alcohol glass bottles purchased from the Candy Box on the pavement. Please can this be cleaned as soon as possible. This is a constant problem so some robust enforcement is required please. Could I suggest that when the shopping Parade is swept by the street cleaning team they can carry out an overlap and check and remove any items of litter from the side of the Candy Box.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris and Toxic spillage from Dustbin Lorry, 11th December
item.description:
Bin collection was 10th Dec and following this no street cleaning undertaken Down most of the road there is debris that hasnt been cleared up after bin collections Outside number 7 there is a toxic spillage. This is not the first time this has happened. Its grey, smells and dangerous to animals. Its a spillage from the bin truck which has happened before Street needs to be cleaned

item.title: Multiple Cars without registration plate, 11th December
item.description:
There are multiple cars without registration plate larked on Riverdale Road for months next to a “pavement garage shop” which always completely block the pavement access to the puplic. Vehicles ae untaxed and uninsured and should not be parked on public roads. Also that garage business should not be allowed to operate as it exploit public pavements and parking spaces. Also it does not looks like that any fire safety are in place there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Saunders Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
